rows.title: Small things

transcript.eng:
Close your eyes.  

Take a moment to stop what you are doing and connect with your breath.   

What is one thing you can be grateful for right now?  
What is one thing that brings you happiness?  
What is one thing that you love?  

They do not have to be big. Sometimes the small things in life count the most!

text_1.eng: Caring for yourself is so essential. When you know how you feel, you can see what you need.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well. Keep up the good work.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: We all have better and worse days. The fact that you are here shows courage and commitment!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Sorry that things are difficult now. It is completely normal to struggle sometimes. Remember that you are not alone!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about family budgets.

Many families are stressed about money, especially if teens keep asking for things!

When we make a budget together, we can agree how to spend AND save to prevent stress and work towards our family’s goals.

media_title.eng: Can creating family budgets help your family? Tap play to learn more

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is family budgeting.

It is important to create a budget, but it is even more important to create a budget involving the entire family.

Doing it together helps increase the level of understanding of how you spend money as a family and how much you save for the family and you can even come up with plans of how you can save as a family.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today's topic is about family budgets.

Many families are stressed about money, especially if teens keep asking for things!

When we make a budget together, we can agree how to spend AND save to prevent stress and work towards our family’s goals.
rows.media_title: Can creating family budgets help your family? Tap play to learn more
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is family budgeting.

It is important to create a budget, but it is even more important to create a budget involving the entire family.

Doing it together helps increase the level of understanding of how you spend money as a family and how much you save for the family and you can even come up with plans of how you can save as a family.

text_1_facilitator.eng: When we involve our teens in budgeting, they learn to be responsible with money and work towards goals. That is something we all want for our teens, right?

media_title.eng: Hear how @data.characters.media_female_6.name involved her teens in budgeting

media_transcript.eng:
Saving and budgeting helps me as a parent, and it helps my teens as well to understand where the money goes.

My teens always asked for a lot of things and they did not understand when I said “I do not have money.” They would say “but you have a job!”

I sat down with them and showed them all the things we pay for and how much is left. They understand now and even give ideas on how we can save to work towards our goals like new shoes or a birthday and bigger goals like their school fees. For the older one, I even opened a savings account.

rows.text_1_facilitator: When we involve our teens in budgeting, they learn to be responsible with money and work towards goals. That is something we all want for our teens, right?
rows.media_title: Hear how @data.characters.media_female_6.name involved her teens in budgeting
rows.media_transcript:
Saving and budgeting helps me as a parent, and it helps my teens as well to understand where the money goes.

My teens always asked for a lot of things and they did not understand when I said “I do not have money.” They would say “but you have a job!”

I sat down with them and showed them all the things we pay for and how much is left. They understand now and even give ideas on how we can save to work towards our goals like new shoes or a birthday and bigger goals like their school fees. For the older one, I even opened a savings account.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
It can be hard to make ends meet every month. Many families have this problem!

Including @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name – let's have a look:

character_1_text.eng: I have been taking care of my grandchildren, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name and @data.characters.f2_son_15.name, since their parents died when they were young. We often struggle with money, as I only receive a small grant.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
It can be hard to make ends meet every month. Many families have this problem!

Including @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name – let's have a look:
rows.character_1_text: I have been taking care of my grandchildren, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name and @data.characters.f2_son_15.name, since their parents died when they were young. We often struggle with money, as I only receive a small grant.

character_1_text.eng: I am so stressed. I don’t have any money left. And now I am fighting with my teens over things they want – again.

rows.character_1_text: I am so stressed. I don’t have any money left. And now I am fighting with my teens over things they want – again.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Dealing with money challenges, like @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name's situation, is stressful. 

A family budget can help @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name - and YOU!

text_2.eng:
**There are four steps for doing a family budget:**

💭 Step 1: THINK 
🎯 Step 2: CHOOSE 
⚒️  Step 3: BUILD 
📋 Step 4: PLAN

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you complete these steps together with your family now?

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: My family can join in now

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
You need:

- 📓Papers (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and pens
- 🫘 Stones or beans or anything with lots of bits to represent money

Take a minute to get these things before we start with the first step.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: Let me try it out by myself

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng:
You need:

- 📓Papers (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and pens
- 🫘 Stones or beans or anything with lots of bits to represent money

Take a minute to get these things before we start with the first step.

rows.quiz_1_question: Can you complete these steps together with your family now?

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Dealing with money challenges, like @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name's situation, is stressful. 

A family budget can help @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name - and YOU!
rows.text_2:
**There are four steps for doing a family budget:**

💭 Step 1: THINK 
🎯 Step 2: CHOOSE 
⚒️  Step 3: BUILD 
📋 Step 4: PLAN

text_1_facilitator.eng:
**Step 1: THINK**
Think about what you spend money on each month.

text_2.eng:
- Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month.
- Write next to each picture how much each thing costs each month (there is no need to share the numbers if you don’t want to).
- Add up how much money you have to spend each month.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
**Step 1: THINK**
Think about what you spend money on each month.
rows.text_2:
- Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month.
- Write next to each picture how much each thing costs each month (there is no need to share the numbers if you don’t want to).
- Add up how much money you have to spend each month.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
**Step 2: CHOOSE**
Think about your needs and wants.
- WANT is something you can live without. 
- NEED is something you cannot live without.

text_2.eng:
Look at your list of things you spend money on and choose:

- Which are NEEDS that you cannot live without? Why?
- Which are WANTS which are nice to have but not essential? Why?
- Which things could you try to spend less money on?

rows.text_1_facilitator:
**Step 2: CHOOSE**
Think about your needs and wants.
- WANT is something you can live without. 
- NEED is something you cannot live without.
rows.text_2:
Look at your list of things you spend money on and choose:

- Which are NEEDS that you cannot live without? Why?
- Which are WANTS which are nice to have but not essential? Why?
- Which things could you try to spend less money on?

text_2.eng:
- Write down what your income is for the month.
- Take some stones or beans or anything with lots of bits - this is your income for the month. For example: If your income is TSh2000 and you have 20 beans, each bean is TSh100.
- Decide what you will spend on, and put the stones/objects on that image.

Not sure about your decisions? Having trouble deciding between "needs" and "wants"? That’s totally fine! This exercise will get easier with practice.

rows.text_2:
- Write down what your income is for the month.
- Take some stones or beans or anything with lots of bits - this is your income for the month. For example: If your income is TSh2000 and you have 20 beans, each bean is TSh100.
- Decide what you will spend on, and put the stones/objects on that image.

Not sure about your decisions? Having trouble deciding between "needs" and "wants"? That’s totally fine! This exercise will get easier with practice.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
**Step 4: PLAN**
Plan how you can save money, so you can deal with emergencies and realise your family goals!

text_2.eng:
If you can save even a tiny amount for the future or emergency - it can make a big difference over time.

- Add a circle called “emergencies”.
- Add a circle called “family goals”.
- Now try to move your money around so you can save a bit every month for goals and emergencies.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
**Step 4: PLAN**
Plan how you can save money, so you can deal with emergencies and realise your family goals!
rows.text_2:
If you can save even a tiny amount for the future or emergency - it can make a big difference over time.

- Add a circle called “emergencies”.
- Add a circle called “family goals”.
- Now try to move your money around so you can save a bit every month for goals and emergencies.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
CONGRATULATIONS!!! 🎉 

You have made your budget! Remember to do this exercise again with your other family members - if you agree on a plan together it will make a huge difference!

Now, let's see how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name made a plan with her money, just like you are doing:

character_1_text.eng:
I want the best future for my grandchildren, but I do not know where to get the money. Loan sharks are dangerous and paying them back is so expensive.

I should save, but that feels impossible!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
CONGRATULATIONS!!! 🎉 

You have made your budget! Remember to do this exercise again with your other family members - if you agree on a plan together it will make a huge difference!

Now, let's see how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name made a plan with her money, just like you are doing:
rows.character_1_text:
I want the best future for my grandchildren, but I do not know where to get the money. Loan sharks are dangerous and paying them back is so expensive.

I should save, but that feels impossible!

character_1_text.eng: My goal is to make sure my grandson can go to high school and my granddaughter can reach her dream of university. How can I save a lot of money with the little money I have?

rows.character_1_text: My goal is to make sure my grandson can go to high school and my granddaughter can reach her dream of university. How can I save a lot of money with the little money I have?

character_1_text.eng: I know – let’s start with a plan! First, let me make a budget – a plan for how I can save my money. Then I will save just a little bit of money at a time – I will even join a stokvel.

rows.character_1_text: I know – let’s start with a plan! First, let me make a budget – a plan for how I can save my money. Then I will save just a little bit of money at a time – I will even join a stokvel.

character_1_text.eng: I should also speak with my grandchildren to choose things that we can spend just a little bit less on each week. They will help me think of things we want but do not need.

rows.character_1_text: I should also speak with my grandchildren to choose things that we can spend just a little bit less on each week. They will help me think of things we want but do not need.

character_1_text.eng: Look, we reached our dreams! I did not borrow any money from friends or loan sharks. By saving a tiny bit each week, I managed to pay for @data.characters.f2_son_15.name’s high school and save some money for @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name’s university. I am so proud of this.

rows.character_1_text: Look, we reached our dreams! I did not borrow any money from friends or loan sharks. By saving a tiny bit each week, I managed to pay for @data.characters.f2_son_15.name’s high school and save some money for @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name’s university. I am so proud of this.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Saving is important for one more reason - emergencies! @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name also learnt this along the way:

character_1_text.eng: One night there was a horrible storm that broke my roof. Everything was flooded. I suddenly had to find money to fix the roof. I just felt defeated.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Saving is important for one more reason - emergencies! @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name also learnt this along the way:
rows.character_1_text: One night there was a horrible storm that broke my roof. Everything was flooded. I suddenly had to find money to fix the roof. I just felt defeated.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Having a savings plan could have helped @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name to be prepared for this kind of emergency! 

There are different ways we can save: at home, by buying things we can sell for profit, at a bank, or in a stokvel.

Think of the advantages and disadvantages of each savings option.

quiz_1_question.eng: What is the best way your family can save?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Whatever savings plan you choose, it will really help your family move forward!

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: Buy things you can sell for profit

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Whatever savings plan you choose, it will really help your family move forward!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Whatever savings plan you choose, it will really help your family move forward!

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Whatever savings plan you choose, it will really help your family move forward!

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Whatever savings plan you choose, it will really help your family move forward!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: Whatever savings plan you choose, it will really help your family move forward!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Whatever savings plan you choose, it will really help your family move forward!
rows.quiz_1_question: What is the best way your family can save?
rows.quiz_1_option_2_text: Buy things you can sell for profit
rows.text_1_facilitator:
Having a savings plan could have helped @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name to be prepared for this kind of emergency! 

There are different ways we can save: at home, by buying things we can sell for profit, at a bank, or in a stokvel.

Think of the advantages and disadvantages of each savings option.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_4: Whatever savings plan you choose, it will really help your family move forward!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
We all have dreams for our family, just like @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name. By setting aside a bit of money every month, you can realise them too!

Let’s come up with some ideas for savings goals for you to make a budget plan.

quiz_1_question.eng: What are your family savings goals?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
Such a great goal!

By making a good budget and saving plan, you can achieve it and feel proud of yourself!

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: Building / expanding a house for my family

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng:
Such a great goal!

By making a good budget and saving plan, you can achieve it and feel proud of yourself!

Such a great goal!

By making a good budget and saving plan, you can achieve it and feel proud of yourself!

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng:
Such a great goal!

By making a good budget and saving plan, you can achieve it and feel proud of yourself!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are this week’s takeaway skills to help you budget and save!

section_1_text.eng: What do we spend on now?

section_1_extra_text.eng:
Write down or draw what you spend money on as a family each month. 

How much does each item cost? 
How much money do you need in total?

section_2_text.eng: Talk together about needs and wants.

section_2_extra_text.eng:
Which expenses are a ‘need’ that you cannot live without? 
Which expenses are a ‘want’ that is nice to have but not essential? 
Which things could you try to spend less on? 

When we explain and listen to each other carefully, we can make good money choices together as a family.

section_3_extra_text.eng:
Write down your income for the month. 
Take stones, beans, or anything with lots of bits - this is your income. 
Agree how much you will spend on each item, and put the objects on that image/word.

section_4_text.eng: Plan for emergencies and family goals.

section_4_extra_text.eng:
Draw a circle ‘emergencies’.
Draw a circle ‘saving’.
Move your ‘money’ around so you can save a bit every month for both.

Which things could you try to spend less on? 

When we explain and listen to each other carefully, we can make good money choices together as a family.

Move your ‘money’ around so you can save a bit every month for both.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
This week's home practice is to make a budget again - this time WITH your teen and family!

This is an important and fun thing to do with your family - it takes about 30 minutes.

text_2.eng:
**Remember to use the four steps for doing a family budget:**

💭 Step 1: THINK (what do we spend on now?)
🎯 Step 2: CHOOSE (what are our needs and wants?)
⚒️ Step 3: BUILD (make your budget) 
📋 Step 4: PLAN (plan for emergencies and family goals)

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you make a budget with your family this week?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Wonderful! Making a family budget is a powerful way to set goals and reduce stress together. Keep it simple and celebrate every small success

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That’s a great start! Even talking about money as a family is a big step. Take it one conversation at a time - you are building important skills together.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That's okay. Budgeting can feel difficult at first. Try starting with one small thing, like planning how to spend this week’s food money, and build from there.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Wonderful! Making a family budget is a powerful way to set goals and reduce stress together. Keep it simple and celebrate every small success
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: That’s a great start! Even talking about money as a family is a big step. Take it one conversation at a time - you are building important skills together.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: That's okay. Budgeting can feel difficult at first. Try starting with one small thing, like planning how to spend this week’s food money, and build from there.
rows.quiz_1_question: Can you make a budget with your family this week?
rows.text_1_facilitator:
This week's home practice is to make a budget again - this time WITH your teen and family!

This is an important and fun thing to do with your family - it takes about 30 minutes.
rows.text_2:
**Remember to use the four steps for doing a family budget:**

💭 Step 1: THINK (what do we spend on now?)
🎯 Step 2: CHOOSE (what are our needs and wants?)
⚒️ Step 3: BUILD (make your budget) 
📋 Step 4: PLAN (plan for emergencies and family goals)

text_1_facilitator.eng:
When we involve teens in budgeting, they learn important life skills, like understanding the difference between needs and wants.

Making a budget together also helps teens see that we all need to make hard choices sometimes, but that it helps us to have enough money at the end of the month - and to realise our goals!

media_title.eng: Can creating family budgets help your family? Tap play to learn more

media_transcript.eng:
I used to ask my mom to buy me nice clothes all the time. Each time, she would say “I do not have money,” but I knew that she was getting money from my uncle. I did not understand why she refused to buy me clothes. I thought at some point “she does not love me.”

But one day, she called me to sit down with her and asked “what are the needs and wants in our house.” I started to list all my needs and wants. Then my mother helped me to also think about the family needs. Now I understand where our money is going, towards the things we need as a family.

From that day, I understand I cannot come in and ask any time. Now, when I want something, I wait till the month-end when we all discuss the budget together to see if it fits. We understand each other better now.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
When we involve teens in budgeting, they learn important life skills, like understanding the difference between needs and wants.

Making a budget together also helps teens see that we all need to make hard choices sometimes, but that it helps us to have enough money at the end of the month - and to realise our goals!
rows.media_title: Can creating family budgets help your family? Tap play to learn more
rows.media_transcript:
I used to ask my mom to buy me nice clothes all the time. Each time, she would say “I do not have money,” but I knew that she was getting money from my uncle. I did not understand why she refused to buy me clothes. I thought at some point “she does not love me.”

But one day, she called me to sit down with her and asked “what are the needs and wants in our house.” I started to list all my needs and wants. Then my mother helped me to also think about the family needs. Now I understand where our money is going, towards the things we need as a family.

From that day, I understand I cannot come in and ask any time. Now, when I want something, I wait till the month-end when we all discuss the budget together to see if it fits. We understand each other better now.
